IMBKGRND.text:
When the IM program starts it checks to see if it is running
 in the address space of a TSO user.  If it is IM will seek to
 provide fullscreen displays on the 3270 TSO terminal.

    If IM is running in the background the device class of the
 IEFRDER file is checked.  If it has a device class of "display"
 or "graphic" (x'10') IM will treat the device as a 3270 screen
 and will seek to use EXCP to provide fullscreen displays on the
 device, which should behave the same as would a TSO terminal
 running IMON.

    For any other device type IEFRDER is considered to be a file
 of fixed-length 80-byte records containing primary input commands
 for the IM program.  End-of-file is treated as the Z command.
 This scenario can be called "running IMON in batch".

    Batch IMON screens are written to IMPLOG as if every screen
 had been printed by the H command.  IMPLOG contains fixed-length
 80-byte records.  Not all screens (eg. the main menu) will be
 written to IMPLOG.  To direct IMPLOG to SYSOUT use
    //IMPLOG   DD  SYSOUT=*
 or equivalent.  To discard IMPLOG output
    //IMPLOG   DD  DUMMY,BLKSIZE=80
 would suffice.

    The IMREPORT file can be used in the same way as it can in
 interactive sessions.  To direct IMREPORT to SYSOUT use
    //IMREPORT DD  SYSOUT=*,RECFM=VB,LRECL=255
 although IMREPORT can be directed to a disk or tape data set
 if programmed post-processing is required.

    The IMON member contains sample JCL for a started task to
 drive a local non-SNA 3270 screen in a stand-alone IMON session
 which does not use VTAM or TSO.

    The IMONBTCH member contains sample JCL to run IMON in batch.

IMDSSTRD.text:
IMDSSTRD TITLE ' READ AND FORMAT IMON DISK SPACE SNAP SHOT FILE '
*
*         WRITTEN 18TH APRIL 2001 BY GREG PRICE
*
IMDSSTRD CSECT
         USING IMDSSTRD,R15
         B     $START
         DROP  R15                 IMDSSTRD.
         DC    AL1(17),C'IMDSSTRD &SYSDATC'
$START   STM   R14,R12,12(R13)
         LR    R11,R15
         USING IMDSSTRD,R11
         LA    R9,SAVE
         ST    R13,SAVE+4
         ST    R9,8(,R13)
         LR    R13,R9
         LA    R10,INREC
         OPEN  (DSSTIN,INPUT)
         OPEN  (DSSTOUT,OUTPUT)
         PUT   DSSTOUT,OUTREC
GETLOOP  GET   DSSTIN,INREC
         CLC   BASEID,INREC+24
         BNE   VOLREC
         USING DSST,R10
         ZAP   WORK,=P'1900000'
         AP    WORK,DSSTDATE
         MVC   OUTDATE,=X'40212020204B202020'
         ED    OUTDATE,WORK+4
         UNPK  OUTTIME(3),DSSTTIME(2)
         UNPK  OUTTIME+3(3),DSSTTIME+1(2)
         MVI   OUTTIME+2,C':'
         MVI   OUTTIME+5,C','
         B     GETLOOP
         DROP  R10
         USING DSSTE,R10
VOLREC   MVC   OUTUNIT,DSSTEUCB
         MVC   OUTVOL,DSSTEVOL
         MVC   OUTSG,DSSTEGRP
         OC    OUTSG,=CL8' '
         SLR   R0,R0
         ICM   R0,3,DSSTETSZ
         CVD   R0,WORK
         OI    WORK+7,X'0F'
         UNPK  OUTSZ,WORK
         L     R0,DSSTECYL
         CVD   R0,WORK
         OI    WORK+7,X'0F'
         UNPK  OUTCYL,WORK
         L     R0,DSSTETRK
         CVD   R0,WORK
         OI    WORK+7,X'0F'
         UNPK  OUTTRK,WORK
         L     R0,DSSTEEXT
         CVD   R0,WORK
         OI    WORK+7,X'0F'
         UNPK  OUTEXT,WORK
         L     R0,DSSTEMXC
         CVD   R0,WORK
         OI    WORK+7,X'0F'
         UNPK  OUTMXC,WORK
         L     R0,DSSTEMXT
         CVD   R0,WORK
         OI    WORK+7,X'0F'
         UNPK  OUTMXT,WORK
         PUT   DSSTOUT,OUTREC
         B     GETLOOP
ENDOFDAT CLOSE (DSSTIN)
         CLOSE (DSSTOUT)
         L     R13,SAVE+4
         LM    R14,R12,12(R13)
         SLR   R15,R15
         BR    R14
         TITLE ' WORKING STORAGE '
WORK     DC    D'0'
SAVE     DC    18F'0'
BASEID   EQU   *,24
         DC    XL20'00',C'DSST'
INREC    DC    CL48' '
OUTREC   DC    CL80' '
         ORG   OUTREC
OUTDATE  DC    C'  DATE   '
         DC    C','
OUTTIME  DC    C'TIME '
         DC    C','
OUTUNIT  DC    C'UNIT'
         DC    C','
OUTVOL   DC    C'VOLUME'
         DC    C','
OUTSG    DC    C'STOGROUP'
         DC    C','
OUTSZ    DC    C'TRKSZ'
         DC    C','
OUTCYL   DC    C'FREEC'
         DC    C','
OUTTRK   DC    C'FREET'
         DC    C','
OUTEXT   DC    C'XTNTS'
         DC    C','
OUTMXC   DC    C'LARGC'
         DC    C','
OUTMXT   DC    C'LARGT'
         ORG
         LTORG
DSSTIN   DCB   DSORG=PS,MACRF=GM,RECFM=FB,LRECL=48,DDNAME=DSSTIN,      +
               EODAD=ENDOFDAT
DSSTOUT  DCB   DSORG=PS,MACRF=PM,RECFM=FB,LRECL=80,DDNAME=DSSTOUT
         COPY  IMSPDSST
         YREGS
         END   IMDSSTRD

IMONTEXT.text:
Here is a file containing I-MON.

  The IMON product for monitoring z/OS systems is
  (C) Copyright 1986-2016 Prycroft Six Pty. Limited.
  Use/install/possess/download at your own risk.
  By unzipping this archive you acknowledge that the
  liability of Prycroft Six is governed by the liability
  statement found at http://www.prycroft6.com.au/support.html


  Serving suggestion:

  BINARY transfer imonload.xmi and imoncntl.xmi to your z/OS system.
  The data sets need to have fixed-length 80-byte records.

  Use the TSO/E RECEIVE command with INDATASET operand
  to produce a load library from imonload.xmi.

  Use the TSO/E RECEIVE command with INDATASET operand
  to produce a JCL library from imoncntl.xmi.

  Apply your site's customization zaps (if any)
  to control access to options and features.



  Call the IM load module from TSO and verify basic functionality.

  Copy the load modules to the appropriate location(s).

  Peruse the JCL library to discover any members of interest.



  Included modules are

 CSVLLIX1 - LLA exit 1.  Required for option "BF".
            Only used by LLA if in the linklist when LLA starts.
            At hex offset 40 is a halfword containing the 4k page
            count used for the fixed-length program table in ECSA.
            You may zap this to change it for your site.  Default=64.
 IM       - Main TSO command and 3270 EXCP started task program.
            Required for all displays.
 IMDATGAT - Program for IMPGAT started task and TSO SMFPRIME processing.
            Required for option "K".
 IMPXAGLS - Help panel module.  Required for PF1/13 or ? processing.
 IMPXASPY - Console display program.
            Required for option "O" other than "OT".
 IMSPACER - Disk free space monitor started task program.
            Required for option "$".


  Examples of TSO commands to invoke IMON:

 im                            display main ("primary") menu
 im ?5                         display terminal "test pattern"
 im ?6                         display terminal character set(s)
 im abjo                       display all batch jobs
 im ato                        display all TSO users
 im d                          display online DASD devices
 im do                         display all DASD devices
 im dt                         display online DASD and tape devices
 im ddt                        display online tape devices
 im dpti                       display online paging disks and tapes in use
 im dvtso                      display DASD volumes beginning with 'tso'
 im ddtv*0                     display tape volumes with '0' in 2nd char
 im ed                         display all hardware reserves
 im ew                         display enqueue conflicts
 im g                          display auto-updating system activity graphs
 im gg                         as above but with a "graph paper" background
 im jrj=                       display your ASID and show RBs
 im jljjes2                    display the JES2 ASID with LLEs
 im japgjdfhsm                 display all displayable data except
                                 registers from the first (lowest ASID)
                                 address space called DFHSM
 im vbcvt                      display the CVT storage contents
 im vb5000                     display data from storage address 5000.
 im z                          clear the screen and terminate

IMSPDSST.text:
*        (C) COPYRIGHT 1989,1993 PRYCROFT SIX PTY LTD
DSST     DSECT                      DISK SPACE SNAP-SHOT TABLE.
DSSTSIZE DS    F                    SIZE OF THIS DSST.
DSSTADDR DS    A                    ADDRESS OF THIS DSST.
DSSTDSST DS    A                    ADDRESS OF NEXT DSST.
DSSTBACK DS    A                    ADDRESS OF PREVIOUS DSST.
DSSTTIME DS    F                    TIME OF SNAP-SHOT.
DSSTDATE DS    PL4                  DATE OF SNAP-SHOT.
DSSTBEND DS    0D
DSSTBLEN EQU   DSSTBEND-DSST        LENGTH OF DSST BASE.
*        END OF DSST BASE WHICH IS THREE (3) DOUBLEWORDS IN SIZE.
DSSTE    DS    0D                   DISK SPACE SNAP-SHOT TABLE ENTRY.
DSSTEUCB DS    A                    UCB ADDRESS OR DEVICE NUMBER.
DSSTEVOL DS    CL6                  VOLUME SERIAL NUMBER AT THE TIME.
DSSTEUSE DS    H                    VOLUME USAGE COUNT AT THE TIME.
DSSTEOPN DS    H                    VOLUME OPEN COUNT AT THE TIME.
DSSTECPV DS    H                    NUMBER OF CYLINDERS ON VOLUME.
DSSTETPC DS    H                    NUMBER OF TRACKS PER CYLINDER.
DSSTETSZ DS    H                    TRACK SIZE IN BYTES.
DSSTECYL DS    F                    FREE CYLINDER COUNT.
DSSTETRK DS    F                    FREE TRACK (NOT IN CYL) COUNT.
DSSTEEXT DS    F                    FREE EXTENT COUNT.
DSSTEMXC DS    F                    LARGEST FREE EXTENT CYLINDER COUNT.
DSSTEMXT DS    F                    LARGEST FREE EXTENT TRACK COUNT.
DSSTEGRP DS    CL8                  SMS STORAGE GROUP NAME.
DSSTEEND DS    0D
DSSTELEN EQU   DSSTEEND-DSSTE       LENGTH OF A DSST VOLUME ENTRY.
*        END OF DSST ENTRY WHICH IS SIX (6) DOUBLEWORDS IN SIZE.
